Valve needed a good testing rat for it's shady plans, and Day of Defeat was the last one at the line to be the less known title of theirs, so here it is. Why can't we play as United Kingdom if that was a choice in the previous installment? Are Allied actually Allied and Axis actually Axis? Can't tell, because the servers were either surfing, orange boxes or German rally meetings where you had everyone muted. For some, good old experience that will be missed forever, but for me, it was orange everywhere and compressed German voice chat. Did I mentioned Valve unwillingly encourages it's fanbase to play Day of Infamy instead?

Day Of Defeat - A Wonderful Throwback 

Back in the early/mid 2000s when Call Of Duty was a major player in the FPS scene it offered brilliant, fun and entertaining shooter set in WW2. These were very fun but included no multiplayer and the ones that did... well the servers are far from alive to say the least. So what if you want a WW2 shooter with graphics and sound effects reek of those simpler times, one where the multiplayer is alive and offers hours of fun. Well, look no further than Day Of Defeat.

Day Of Defeat is a WW2 FPS Shooter with no story but a massive multiplayer scene which has plenty of servers for you to play on. On standard servers you either play as America or Germany and have to take control of 5 different points to win a game. Alternatively you can play a bomb mode in which your team and the enemy team has 2 bombsites in which you have to stop the enemy team from coming onto and planting said bomb. You can do this with a variety of classes which boast their own weaponry and skills meaning there's always something new to try if the previous wasn't working for you. If none of this sounds remotely interesting to you then why not try a modded server instead? DOD has many servers made by the community offering alternate game modes, classes and maps! 

The graphics still hold up quite well in  my opinion but maybe that's because I'm a dork for this early 2000s/ late 90s graphic style that the game throws at you but it's not ugly to look at and buildings, guns character models and everything look great! In fact, it's quite aesthetically pleasing. Oh and a last note, the rag-doll physics in this game are absolutely hilarious. 

Sounds in this game are phenomenal! Guns blazing left, right and centre, explosions as you charge up to capture a point, footsteps and even more are all just fantastic and a super high quality I cannot express how much I love these. 

But with all that sad there are some cons. Some games contain a lot of BOTS, the recoil on these guns is absolutely insane and takes a long while to master, you have less health than somebody on life support it's like you have 1HP and on the majority of servers it's impossible to heal. 

To conclude Day Of Defeat satisfies the WW2 style multiplayer shooter many of us crave but if that's not what you want/crave it's still a very good fps and I highly recommend it despite it's few drawbacks. 

9.2/10 ~ Neppy Review
